items.sentence: I read an article about acid rain yesterday.
I remember the first time I heard this song.
I rode a horse for the first time yesterday.

Try to look at it from Tom\'s point of view.
Tom accused Mary of lying through her teeth.
Tom advised Mary not to go there by herself.
Tom advised Mary not to leave her door open.
Tom already knows you want to quit your job.
He\'ll probably finish the work by tomorrow.
He\'s so thin that he looks like a skeleton.
Here\'s a list of everything you need to do.
There\'s a hole in the bottom of the bucket.
That doesn\'t mean that I\'ll stop doing it.
That\'s the stupidest thing I\'ve ever said.
My brother wants to go to the moon some day.
My brother was killed in a traffic accident.
My cat purrs when I scratch behind his ears.
My daughter is looking forward to Christmas.
My doctor recommended I eat more vegetables.
My dog follows me whenever I leave the room.
That chicken hasn\'t laid any eggs recently.
Don\'t worry about the results of your test.
Don\'t you ever speak to me like that again.
Don\'t you have something in my price range?
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.

After I locked all the doors, I went to bed.
Tom was the most popular boy in high school.
Tom was the one who asked all the questions.
Tom was the one who came up with the design.
My body isn\'t as flexible as it used to be.

Tom looks somewhat nervous and apprehensive.

Tom loves playing Irish tunes on the fiddle.

Tom is more experienced in business than me.
